title: Does Windows 10 natively support usb boot?

forumNotes.author: pazhanii
forumNotes.content: I created a vhd in pc installed windows 10 and copied to pen drive of windows 10 and linked to boot manager and tried to boot from pen drive, it works without any additional boot watcher or disk layer software. How it works? Does windows 10 support usb boot by nature?

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> Does windows 10 support usb boot by nature?
.  
Windows 10 supports USB boot by nature.  
BootDriverFlags was suported at Windows 7 Embedded. [https://msdn.microso...bedded.60).aspx](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-US/library/ff793561(v=winembedded.60).aspx "External link")  
And is enabled by default at Windows 8 and Windows 10.

forumNotes.content: Thanks for your kind reply. I have enlightened.
